greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts, with each part divisible by the next.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: A122651r := proc(n,pmax,dv) option remember ; local a,d ; a := 0 ; for d in dv do if d = n and d <= pmax then a := a+1 ; elif d < pmax and n-d > 0 then a := a+A122651r(n-d,d-1,numtheory[divisors](d) minus {d} ) ; fi; od: a ; end: A122651 := proc(n) local i; A122651r(n,n, convert([seq(i,i=1..n)],set) ) ; end: for n from 1 to 120 do printf("%d,",A122651(n)) ; od:  # _R. J. Mathar_, May 22 2009
mathematica: b[0] = 1; b[n_] := b[n] = Sum[b[(n - d)/d], {d, Divisors[n] // Rest}]; a[0] = 1; a[n_] := b[n] + b[n-1]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 84}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 26 2013, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: (PARI) { a(n,m=0) = local(r=0); if(n==0,return(1)); fordiv(n,d, if(d<=m,next); r+=a((n-d)\d,1); ); r } /* _Max Alekseyev_ */
results.author: _Zak Seidov_, _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_ and _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 21 2006
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, May 22 2009
